ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Deeper exposure to French Marxist philosophy A greater appreication public spaces
This class allowed me to rethink space and religious implications of space.
This course was interesting and explored a range of topics. I thought it would have more relevance to performance space for artists, but it was interesting nonetheless
greater recognition of the ways that law shapes religious use of space in the US.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I really liked being able to conduct my own research as an application of the topics considered in lecture It would have been really helpful to be given a concrete due date for the final assignment. I wasn't really sure when it was due; when time is at a premium during paper writing and finals season, you really want to know what to prioritize and when.
I think the student presentations should only be about 30 minutes and then have the professor teach the material.
It could have a little more teacher-led discussion

the instructors did not communicate well between the two of them. The professors relied fully on students to facilitate discussion. More of their expertise needed to be asserted in the course. The course was unnecessarily difficult because ambiguity: the goals of course were unclear and not reinforced throughout the semester. There was in many ways too much latitude without adequate direction.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes. This is a good course for people who are interested in discussing the implications for the interaction of secular and sacred spaces; it should be clearer that this class is not for people who want a primer in how to design sacred spaces.
absolutely, we need the think about how religious is enacted even in and through spaces.
Yes, I would recommend knowing a little about religious spaces and symbolism.
No, I would not recommend the course. I would recommend some of the essays to read, but the course was not a great asset towards engaging the material.
